alert.note: Alert for Southern Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 08 at 3:47PM EST until January 10 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (5.1 to 8.4 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...In Massachusetts, Southern Bristol MA County. In Rhode Island, Southeast Providence RI, Eastern Kent RI, Bristol RI, Washington RI and Newport RI Counties. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor to perhaps moderate flooding can be expected across low-lying areas of Newport, Middletown and Portsmouth, as well as areas along Narragansett Bay. Several immediate coastal roads will be impassable for a few hours around time of high tide. Beach erosion along the ocean exposed coastline is likely. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
